options.content:
## üéØ Troubleshooting Poor User Experience

Diagnosing poor user experience in virtual sessions is complex ‚Äî it requires analyzing multiple layers such as input responsiveness, protocol performance, system load, and network conditions. This dashboard helps simplify that process.

Start by identifying sessions with **high session delay** (input delay + protocol latency), then use the lower panels to investigate **root causes** like app or network performance issues.

> üí° **Tip:** Click on a username in any data table to **filter the entire dashboard** to that specific user's session.

---

## üßÆ Why Percentiles Matter

Most metrics in this dashboard (e.g. input delay, protocol latency, CPU, RAM, Disk) are calculated using the **80th percentile**, rather than the average or maximum.

- The **80th percentile** means: "80% of the time, values were below this number."
- It helps **ignore brief spikes**, while still highlighting **consistently poor performance**.
- It's more realistic for assessing **typical user experience** than using averages.

---

## üß™ What Is Session Delay?

**Session Delay** = **User Input Delay** + **Protocol Latency**

- **Protocol Latency**: Measures network-related delay in remoting protocols like ICA or RDP.
- **User Input Delay**: Captures the time between user input (e.g. keypress) and the moment it is picked up by the application ‚Äî a direct indicator of system/app responsiveness.

---

## üìä How To Interpret Session Delay

Session delay categories used in this dashboard:

- üü¢ **Excellent**: consistently **below 40‚ÄØms**
- üîµ **Good**: mostly below 40‚ÄØms, always **below 200‚ÄØms**
- üü° **Mediocre**: consistently **below 400‚ÄØms**
- üî¥ **Poor**: frequently **above 400‚ÄØms**

> ‚ÑπÔ∏è [More info on user input delay](https://uberagent.com/blog/uberagent-7-1-preview-user-input-delay-application-responsiveness/)

panels.description: The 80th percentile of protocol latency + input delay for all sessions. Gauges the overall user experience.

targets.query:
Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend delay = SessionInputDelaySumMs/SessionInputDelayCount
| summarize 
delay = percentile(delay,80),
SessionRpLatencyMs =  percentile(column_ifexists("SessionRpLatencyMs", 0),80)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg)
| extend session_delay = delay + SessionRpLatencyMs
| project-away delay, SessionRpLatencyMs

panels.title: Session delay overview

targets.query:
Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| summarize 
session_count = count_distinct(SessionGUID)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg)
| sort by Timestamp

panels.description: The table lists all sessions in the selected timeframe, sorted by session delay. Click on a session to filter the dashboard.

targets.query:
Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend delay = SessionInputDelaySumMs / SessionInputDelayCount
| summarize 
user = max(SessionUser),
machine = max(Host),
logon = max(SessionLogonTime),
protocol = max(SessionProtocol),
state = max(SessionConnectionState),
client_ip = max(column_ifexists("SessionClientIp","")),
client_name = max(column_ifexists("SessionClientName","")),
client_os = max(column_ifexists("SessionClientPlatform","")),
client_version = max(column_ifexists("SessionClientVersion","")),
ctx_transport = max(column_ifexists("SessionTransportProtocols","")),
ctx_apps = max(column_ifexists("SessionPublishedAppsCtx","")),
id = max(SessionID),
delay = percentile(delay,80),
SessionRpLatencyMs =  percentile(column_ifexists("SessionRpLatencyMs", 0),80)
by SessionGUID
| extend user_machine = strcat(user,"@",machine)
| extend user_without_ad = replace(@"^[^\\]+\\", "", user)
| extend session_delay = delay + SessionRpLatencyMs
| project user_machine, session_id = id, session_delay, state, logon, protocol, client_ip, client_name, client_os, client_version, user_without_ad, machine, ctx_transport, ctx_apps
| sort by session_delay desc

panels.title: Session table

panels.description: The 80th percentile of protocol latency + input delay per session

targets.query:
Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains '$User'
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend delay = SessionInputDelaySumMs / SessionInputDelayCount
| summarize 
delay = percentile(delay,80),
SessionRpLatencyMs =  percentile(column_ifexists("SessionRpLatencyMs", 0),80),
user = max(SessionUser),
host = max(Host),
id = max(SessionID)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), SessionGUID
| extend user_host = strcat(user, "(", id, ")","@",host)
| extend user_without_ad = replace(@"^[^\\]+\\", "", user)
| extend latency_p80 = delay + SessionRpLatencyMs
| project-away delay, SessionRpLatencyMs, SessionGUID, id
| evaluate pivot(user_host, max(latency_p80))

panels.title: Delay per session over time

options.content:
The charts below split the **session delay** in its components: **protocol latency** and **input delay**.

## High protocol latency

Protocol latency is the time it takes to send a request to the VDA, or the computer where uberAgent is running on, and receive a response. A high value indicates network issues or not enough bandwidth.

Specifically for ICA sessions, the **ICA RTT** chart shows the time between user action and screen response, including ICA latency, endpoint delay, and host delay.

## High input delay

High input delay indicates that the VDA, or the computer where uberAgent is installed, has not enough resources available to process the request. It is worth checking the machine and app compute charts below, to see if the machine is overloaded or if an app is consuming too much CPU or memory.

targets.query:
Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains '$User'
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize 
protocol_latency =  percentile(column_ifexists("SessionRpLatencyMs", 0),80),
user = max(SessionUser),
host = max(Host),
id = max(SessionID)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), SessionGUID
| extend user_host = strcat(user, "(", id, ")","@",host)
| project-away  SessionGUID, id
| evaluate pivot(user_host, max(protocol_latency))

Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains '$User'
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize 
rtt = max(column_ifexists("SessionRoundTripTimeMs",0)),
user = max(SessionUser),
host = max(Host),
id = max(SessionID)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), SessionGUID
| extend user_host = strcat(user, "(", id, ")","@",host)
| project-away  SessionGUID, id
| evaluate pivot(user_host, max(rtt))

Session_SessionDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where SessionUser != "sys"
| where SessionUser contains '$User'
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend delay = SessionInputDelaySumMs / SessionInputDelayCount
| summarize 
delay = percentile(delay,80),
user = max(SessionUser),
host = max(Host),
id = max(SessionID)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), SessionGUID
| extend user_host = strcat(user, "(", id, ")","@",host)
| project-away  SessionGUID, id
| evaluate pivot(user_host, max(delay))

panels.description:
Stop errors are blue screens, power losses, and kernel panics (macOS).

More about error codes (Windows): https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/debugger/bug-check-code-reference2

    3221226010,"STATUS_SYSTEM_PROCESS_TERMINATED",
    3221226017,"STATUS_IMAGE_CHECKSUM_MISMATCH",
    3735936685,"MANUALLY_INITIATED_CRASH1"
];
System_Bugcheck
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host has "$Computer"
| join kind=leftouter BugCheckLookup on BugcheckCode
| extend BugName = coalesce(BugName, tostring(tohex(toint(BugcheckCode), 4)))
| summarize
Error = max(BugName)
by bin(Timestamp, 1s), Host

panels.title: Stop errors

targets.query:
System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize usage = percentile(CPUUsagePercent, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(usage))

System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize usage = percentile(RAMUsagePercent, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(usage))

System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize usage = percentile(IOPercentDiskTime, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(usage))

System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend io_latency = IOLatencyMsRead + IOLatencyMsWrite
| summarize io_latency = sum(io_latency) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(io_latency))

System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize usage = percentile(NetUtilizationPercent, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(usage))

System_SystemPerformanceSummary2
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| summarize usage = percentile(PagefileUsagePercent, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), Host
| evaluate pivot(Host, max(usage))

Process_ProcessStatistics
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| extend delay = ProcInputDelaySumMs / ProcInputDelayCount
| summarize delay = percentile(delay, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(delay))
| sort by Timestamp

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize cpu_usage = percentile(ProcCPUPercent, 80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(cpu_usage))

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize mem = percentile(ProcWorkingSetMB,80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(mem))

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize 
ProcIOReadCount = sum(ProcIOReadCount),
ProcIOWriteCount = sum(ProcIOWriteCount)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| extend io_count = ProcIOWriteCount + ProcIOReadCount
| project-away ProcIOReadCount, ProcIOWriteCount
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(io_count))

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize net = percentile(ProcNetKBPS,80)/1024 by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(net))

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize 
gpu = percentile(ProcGpuComputePercent,80)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(gpu))

Process_ProcessDetail
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize mem = percentile(ProcGpuMemMB,80) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(mem))

Process_ProcessStatistics
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize count = sum(ProcHandleCount) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(count))

Process_ProcessStatistics
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize count = sum(ProcThreadCount) by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), AppId
| evaluate pivot(AppId, max(count))

Application_Errors
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize 
Crashes = sum(ErrorType)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), App
| evaluate pivot(App, max(Crashes))
| sort by Timestamp

panels.description:
Lists all crashes and hangs by process. 

If you need more granular time buckets, change the time aggregation dashboard variable.

targets.query:
Application_Errors
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp)
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| extend type = case(ErrorType == 1, "crash", ErrorType == 2, "hang", "unknown")
| summarize 
count = sum(ErrorType),
modules = make_set(ModuleName),
exception_codes = make_set(ExceptionCode),
type = max(type)
by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), process = ProcName, process_version = ProcVersion, app = App, user = ProcUser, computer = Host
| project-rename time_bucket = Timestamp
| project time_bucket, process, process_version, app, type, user, computer, count, modules, exception_codes

panels.title: Errors & Hangs details

panels.description: Click on an app to filter the dashboard.

targets.query:
Process_NetworkTargetPerformance
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp) 
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| extend target = coalesce(NetTargetRemoteName,NetTargetRemoteAddress)
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| summarize 
  latency_p80 = percentile(NetTargetSendLatencyMs,80),
  receive_count = sum(NetTargetReceiveCount),
  send_count = sum(NetTargetSendCount),
  reconnect_count = sum(NetTargetReconnectCount),
  retransmit_count = sum(NetTargetRetransmitCount),
  send_vol = sum(NetTargetSendMB),
  receive_vol = sum(NetTargetReceiveMB)
  by App, Target = target, Port = NetTargetRemotePort
| sort by App asc, Target asc

panels.title: Data table

panels.description: Select an app in the table above to filter this time chart

targets.query:
Process_NetworkTargetPerformance
| where $__timeFilter(Timestamp) 
| where ProcUser contains "$User"
| where Host contains "$Computer"
| extend App = coalesce(AppId,ProcName)
| where App contains "$App"
| extend target = coalesce(NetTargetRemoteName,NetTargetRemoteAddress)
| summarize 
  latency_p80 = percentile(NetTargetSendLatencyMs,80)
  by bin(Timestamp, $time_agg), App, Target = target, Port = NetTargetRemotePort
| sort by App asc, Target asc , Port asc
| extend target_full = strcat(App," -> ",Target,":",Port)
| project Timestamp, target_full, latency_p80
| evaluate pivot(target_full, max(latency_p80))

list.description: Filter the dashboard to usernames or parts of username. I.e. "jo" would include the users "joe" and "john".
list.name: User

list.description: Filter the dashboard to computer names or parts of computer names. I.e. "pc" would include the computers "pc1" and "pc-test".
list.label: Machine
list.name: Computer

list.description: Filter the dashboard to an app or parts of app names. I.e. "my" would include the apps "my-dev-app" and "my-hr-app".
list.name: App

list.description: Time series charts aggregate metrics over a time frame. You can change the time frame here.
list.label: Time aggregation
list.name: time_agg
